name: Drawer Sliding
author: JSP infotech

sections.description:
The Drawer Sliding plugin enables you to seamlessly display content, custom HTML, menus, minicarts, and shortcodes within a sliding drawer. You can configure the drawer to slide from either the left or right, offering a flexible way to incorporate hidden content areas on your site. The plugin allows for easy customization of the handle text, and you can trigger the drawer to open by clicking on a custom button, image, or any element assigned a unique drawer class. This makes it a versatile tool for enhancing user interaction with dynamic, accessible content.

Key features:
* Sliding drawer for displaying content, shortcodes, and more
* Configurable sliding direction: left or right
* Ability to add a menu within the drawer
* Setup a minicart for WooCommerce stores
* Customizable handle text for a personalized touch
* Option to open the drawer using a button, image, or custom element

License

sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload the ‘drawer-sliding’ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Navigate to Dashboard Menu → Drawer to configure the plugin.
  4. Click on Add New to create a new drawer.
  5. Configure the drawer settings and details (such as content, handle text, etc.).
  6. Click on Publish to save your drawer.
sections.faq:
How do I add a drawer to my page?

To add a drawer, follow these steps:
1. Go to Dashboard → Drawer and click Add New.
2. Configure your drawer with the desired content, custom HTML, or shortcodes.
3. Use the unique class assigned to the drawer to trigger it using a button or custom element on your page.

Can I customize the appearance of the drawer?

Yes, you can customize the handle text, the sliding direction, and even the trigger element for opening the drawer.

Can I use shortcodes inside the drawer?

Yes, the drawer supports WordPress shortcodes.
